captions.text: ♫ Sola, Sola in the oblivion ♫
♫ Sola, sola with his spirit ♫
I always listened to this song
And thought about Felipe Solá, the politician.
So, a given tuesday, at 3 pm,
that is that moment of the week when absolutely nothing happens
I created an image to see if anyone else had thought about that
So I made this.
That evening, the image had more than 15k shares on Facebook
But the best of all happened a couple of hours later
when the real Felipe Solá tweeted the photo.
I've always lived far from my school, my college, my jobs...
For what I always needed to take the bus.
I think that the bus is that special place in which we can be ourselves
We can think, sleep, listen to music

We can observe the people,
wondering where are they going,

Who hasn't ever mentally participated
on a stranger conversation on the bus
Thinking 'he has to do this', or that...
Or we may look through the window,

I think the bus window reflects much more
than the things we see through it
To me, it's like a philosophy school

I had had a lot of time taking down notes
about the things I observed that happend on the bus
Until I decided that I wanted to share them with the world.

So I created a Facebook Page
called "De bondis" (About buses)
In which I...
The upcoming slides may benonsense if you clap right now...

Ok, it's a page in which I share stuff like
do you know how to stop the public transportation?
Well, doing this you stop the cab
Doing this, you stop the bus
Wait please! You're laughing and I even said the joke yet!
Doing this, you stop the bus that comes behind the nearest bus.
And, well, this is when the bus just doesn't stop

Sometimes the bus driver is a bit hurried,
you must hold yourself someway
Dive through the music, why not
Or the air conditioner in the long distance bus, it just has no tact
It may be hell or artic pole, there's no balance point.

Or the rejection we feel when we take courage,
go towards the bus outside the designated stop
and he just says 'no, no'
while the other people are staring at you...

Or when people get stuck in the front,
whereas at the end is pretty empty...
why don't you move on?!
Today, it's more than 10 months since I created it
And we are a great family
With more than 95k people. Almost a hundred.

I had another idea. A tribute to those things
that are not designed in the best way
So I created a page called 'Shitty inventions'

In whih I published things like
this red precint

It's called 'Easy opening'.
I wonder if someone could ever easy-open anything.
Or that impossible packagings, for which you need some scissors

Except when there are inside the packaging,
it gets complicated then.

This napkins,
I strongly believe there are waterproof.

I just can't get it, sincerely, 10 napkins do the same function
than one made of paper. Who was the genious mind?
Today, also, one year after since I created it...
it has also 78, 79... followers. Little page, a cozy one.
The most difficult thing about doing anything is to start.

We feel that there's no time, no resources,
the idea won't fullfill our expectations
De Bondis was born as a plain color blog

But after talking about it with my uncle, my friends,
work colleagues, it evolved until what it is today.
We're experiencing a time in which everybody loves to collaborate, say and share their opinion on every single topic
In order to be criticized, today you only need to express your opinion on social media.
But that is extremely positive, because people started to send photos about weird things they saw on the bus

One day they sent:
'Hey, this guy looks alike Caruso Lombardi'
So I said... 'Ok, let's do a celebrities-alike album!'
And it was born that day.
This is the double one, really difficult to find, the hard figurine.
This one was published on TV
Well, I can't get how this guy walks through the streets like that
The bus is relative.
'Indio Solari'
This one is tremendous.
It's complicated.

I'm always having new ideas.
And I'm always trying to make them happen.
Because if I don't do that, someday probably anyone else will execute the same ideas instead of me

But mainly because if I don't make them happen
I start to feel resentful with myself
And the only thing I get is to avoid moving forward.
And any idea, no matter how stupid it is, is not letting futher ideas appear.

'Shitty inventions' was born one month before De Bondis,
and if I hadn't created it, maybe De Bondis wouldn't have existed
So, probably you'll get out of here thinking a lot of ideas, with a lot of stuff travelling through your mind

Think while on the bus, tell your ideas to anyone else,
because by talking about them you realize their weaknesses
just by listening to yourself
but try to make them for real,

because an idea that you don't make happen
exists only inside your mind.
Thank you.

title: Ideas en colectivo: Francisco Crescimbeni at TEDxAvCorrientes 2013
